item.title: 土库曼斯坦通过加密货币采矿和交易所监管法
item.description: 据土库曼斯坦国家媒体周五报道，土库曼斯坦通过了一项法律，对数字资产进行合法化和监管，包括为加密货币交易所和加密货币采矿公司颁发许可证。【原文：Turkmenistan has passed a law legalising and regulating digital assets, including licences for cryptocurrency exchanges and crypto mining companies, state media reported on Friday.】

item.title: 苹果公司告知欧盟委员会它符合《数字市场法》（DMA）的要求
item.description: 美国科技巨头苹果公司周五在一份声明中告诉欧盟委员会，其核心平台服务苹果广告和苹果地图达到了《数字市场法案》规定的门槛。【原文：U.S. tech giant Apple told the European Commission its core platform services Apple Ads and Apple Maps meet the thresholds set by the Digital Markets Act, the Commission said in a statement on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称中国百度第三季度亏损后开始裁员
item.description: 六位知情人士透露，中国百度本周开始裁员，将对多个业务部门造成冲击，因为该公司正努力应对人工智能领域日益激烈的竞争和广告收入的下降。【原文：China's Baidu started layoffs this week that will hit multiple business units, six sources briefed on the matter said, as the company struggles with intensifying competition in artificial intelligence and declining advertising revenue.】

item.title: 早间竞标不温不火的十一月
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：银行正在洽谈贷款 380 亿美元，用于资助 OpenAI 网站
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引知情人士的话报道称，一批银行正在洽谈为甲骨文公司和数据中心建造商 Vantage 再贷款 380 亿美元，以资助 OpenAI 的进一步建设。【原文：A group of banks is in talks to lend another $38 billion for Oracle and data centre builder Vantage to fund further sites for OpenAI, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 数据中心冷却问题导致芝加哥商品交易所交易停止
item.description: 交易所运营商芝加哥商品交易所集团周五表示，由于数据中心出现冷却问题，衍生品市场交易已经停止。【原文：Exchange operator CME Group said on Friday trading in derivative markets was halted due to a cooling issue at data centres.】

item.title: 韩联社报道：韩国怀疑朝鲜是加密货币交易所 Upbit 遭黑客攻击的幕后黑手
item.description: 据韩联社周五报道，韩国怀疑朝鲜团队可能是最近黑客攻击加密货币交易所 Upbit 的幕后黑手，该事件导致 445 亿韩元（约合 3040 万美元）的加密货币被擅自提取。【原文：South Korea suspects a North Korean team may be behind the recent hacking of cryptocurrency exchange Upbit that led to the unauthorised withdrawal of 44.5 billion won ($30.4 million) in cryptocurrencies, the Yonhap News Agency reported on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储减息押注助推亚洲股市走强，结束艰难的十一月
item.description: 由于美国即将降息的希望重燃，有助于舒缓估值焦虑，并使国债连续第四个月反弹，亚洲股市将以较为平稳的态势结束艰难的十一月。【原文：Asian shares are set to end a tough November on steadier ground as revived hopes of an imminent U.S. rate cut helped soothe valuation jitters and sent Treasuries rallying for a fourth straight month.】

item.title: 美元有望创四个月来最差一周，美联储减息理由不断增强
item.description: 周五，由于交易商加大了对美联储下月进一步宽松货币政策的押注，同时美国感恩节假期导致流动性减少，美元正朝着7月底以来表现最差的一周迈进。【原文：The U.S. dollar was heading for its worst weekly performance since late July on Friday as traders ramped up bets for further monetary easing from the Federal Reserve next month, while liquidity was thinned by the U.S. Thanksgiving holiday.】

item.title: 投资者关注俄乌谈判和欧佩克+，布伦特原油价格变化不大
item.description: 布伦特原油期货周五变化不大，因为投资者在关注俄乌和谈的进展以及周日欧佩克+会议的结果，以寻找供应可能发生变化的线索，供应变化一直在拖累油价。【原文：Brent crude oil futures were little changed on Friday as investors eyed the progress of the Russia-Ukraine peace talks and the outcome of the OPEC+ meeting on Sunday for clues on potential changes in supply which has been weighing on prices.】

item.title: 澳大利亚房价在市场紧缩的情况下将上涨约 7%：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社对分析师进行的一项调查显示，由于供应紧张和需求弹性，2026 年澳大利亚房价的涨幅将超过此前预期。【原文：Australian home prices will rise more than previously expected in 2026, thanks to tight supply and resilient demand, according to a Reuters poll of analysts who said a lack of entry-level homes is still among the biggest barriers for first-time buyers.】

item.title: 独家：美国加征关税，中越关系升温，华为和中兴在越南达成 5G 协议
item.description: 七位直接了解情况的人士告诉路透社记者，中国领先的电信公司华为和中兴今年赢得了在越南供应 5G 设备的一系列合同，这是河内与中国政府加强联系的又一迹象，引起了西方官员的担忧。【原文：China's leading telecommunication firms Huawei and ZTE have won a string of contracts this year to supply 5G equipment in Vietnam, in another sign of Hanoi's strengthening bonds with Beijing, stirring concern among Western officials, seven people with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters.】

item.title: 运动组织称欧盟应拒绝汽车制造商的生物燃料请求
item.description: 活动组织 T&E 周四表示，欧盟委员会应抵制汽车制造商关于允许汽车在 2035 年以后使用生物燃料的呼吁，因为生物燃料供应短缺，而且并非真正的碳中和。【原文：The European Commission should resist automakers' calls to allow cars to run on biofuels beyond 2035 because they are in short supply and not truly carbon-neutral, campaign group T&E said on Thursday.】

item.title: Salesforce 数据显示，美国感恩节在线销售额预计增长 6
item.description: Salesforce周四的数据显示，美国感恩节假期的在线销售额预计将比去年增长6%，达到86亿美元，这表明在关税引发的宏观经济不确定性的背景下，购物者正在抢购零售商提供的大幅折扣，以进行挥霍。【原文：Online sales in the U.S. on the Thanksgiving holiday are expected to rise 6% compared with last year to reach $8.6 billion, data from Salesforce showed on Thursday, suggesting shoppers were lapping up steep discounts from retailers to splurge amid tariff-induced macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 荷兰芯片制造商 Nexperia 敦促中国企业帮助恢复供应链
item.description: 荷兰芯片制造商 Nexperia 的供应链在今年 9 月荷兰政府接管该公司时中断，该公司周四在一封公开信中敦促其中国子公司帮助恢复正常生产。【原文：Dutch chipmaker Nexperia , whose supply chain was broken up when the Dutch government took over the company in September, urged its Chinese units in an open letter on Thursday to help restore normal production.】

item.title: 央行机构国际清算银行就对冲基金在政府债券市场上的杠杆作用发出警告
item.description: 国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）新任行长表示，考虑到公共债务水平的快速增长，控制对冲基金在政府债券市场进行高杠杆押注的能力应成为政策制定者的关键优先事项。【原文：The new head of the Bank for International Settlements has said reining in hedge funds' ability to make highly leveraged bets in government bond markets should be a key priority for policymakers given rapidly increasing public debt levels.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，美国证交会正在调查杰富瑞与破产的 First Brands 公司的交易
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引知情人士的话报道称，美国证券交易委员会正在调查投资银行杰富瑞（Jefferies）与破产汽车零部件供应商第一品牌集团（First Brands Group）的关系。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is probing investment bank Jefferies over its relationship with bankrupt auto parts supplier First Brands Group, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道消息称地中海航运和贝莱德竞购和记巴塞罗那码头面临欧盟调查
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士周四表示，贝莱德和地中海航运收购长江和记大部分全球港口业务的交易在欧洲面临障碍，欧盟反垄断监管机构将对该交易的西班牙部分进行调查。【原文：BlackRock and MSC's bid for most of CK Hutchison's global port operations faces a hurdle in Europe with EU antitrust regulators set to investigate the Spanish portion of the deal, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道美国防务公司安杜里尔面临无人机坠毁的挫折
item.description: 本月早些时候，一架美国军用飞机在佛罗里达州埃格林空军基地上空翱翔，放飞了一架由国防科技巨头安杜里尔工业公司制造的无人机，以测试它是否可以飞行和进行监视。【原文：A U.S. military plane soared over Florida's Eglin Air Force Base earlier this month and released a drone made by the defense tech giant Anduril Industries to test whether it could take flight and conduct surveillance.】

item.title: 荷兰检察官以逃税为由对摩根士丹利处以 1.01 亿欧元罚款
item.description: 荷兰公共检察官（OM）周四表示，已对摩根士丹利在伦敦和阿姆斯特丹的两个实体处以总计 1.01 亿欧元（1.171 亿美元）的罚款，原因是其股息逃税。【原文：The Dutch Public Prosecutor (OM) has imposed a total fine of 101 million euros ($117.10 million) on two Morgan Stanley entities in London and Amsterdam for dividend tax evasion, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西寻求美国合作，调查特拉华州公司洗钱问题
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）周四告诉记者，巴西政府将寻求与美国达成合作协议，以打击洗钱和非法武器出口。【原文：Brazil's government will seek a cooperation agreement with the U.S. to fight money laundering and the illegal export of weapons, Finance Minister Fernando Haddad told reporters on Thursday.】

item.title: 玻利维亚面包短缺凸显补贴改革挑战
item.description: 玻利维亚国家补贴的马拉凯塔面包卷短缺，这是对新当选总统罗德里戈-帕斯的早期考验，因为小麦供应减少和成本上升挤压了面包师，也让消费者感到沮丧。【原文：Shortages of Bolivia's state-subsidized marraqueta bread roll are creating an early test for newly elected President Rodrigo Paz, as dwindling wheat supplies and rising costs squeeze bakers and frustrate consumers.】

item.title: 法国反垄断监管机构驳回针对微软的投诉
item.description: 法国反垄断监督机构周四驳回了本地搜索引擎 Qwant 对微软的投诉，该投诉指控美国公司滥用其市场支配地位。【原文：French antitrust watchdog on Thursday dismissed a complaint filed against Microsoft by local search engine Qwant which accused the U.S. company of abusing its dominant position.】

item.title: 瑞士议员要求调查向特朗普赠送礼品是否违法
item.description: 据报道，瑞士商界领袖向美国总统唐纳德-特朗普赠送了包括劳力士手表和金条在内的礼物，两名瑞士议员要求检察官审查这些礼物是否可能违反了瑞士的反贿赂法。【原文：Two Swiss lawmakers have asked prosecutors to examine whether gifts reportedly given to U.S. President Donald Trump - including a Rolex watch and a gold bar - by Swiss business leaders may have violated Switzerland's anti-bribery laws.】

item.title: 法国对 2009 年里约-巴黎坠机事件的上诉审判进入高潮
item.description: 法国国家航空公司和空中客车公司就公司过失杀人的指控展开了激烈的争论，2009 年法航一架客机坠毁，228 名乘客和机组人员全部遇难，为期八周的巴黎审判于本周四进入收尾阶段。【原文：An eight-week Paris trial over the 2009 crash of an Air France jet with the loss of all 228 passengers and crew reached closing stages on Thursday as France's national carrier and Airbus battle charges of corporate manslaughter.】

item.title: 苹果一手推动光棍节智能手机销量增长
item.description: 研究公司 Counterpoint 周四称，中国 "光棍节 "购物节期间对苹果公司 iPhone 的强劲需求单独推动了这一时期智能手机销量的增长。【原文：Strong demand for Apple's iPhone during China's Singles' Day shopping festival single-handedly drove growth in smartphone sales during the period, research firm Counterpoint said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧盟就网络欺诈保护新规则达成一致
item.description: 欧洲议会周四表示，欧盟成员国和欧洲议会已就新规则达成一致，以迫使银行和其他支付服务提供商更好地保护客户免受在线欺诈、隐藏费用和数据泄露的侵害。【原文：EU member states and the European Parliament have agreed on new rules to force banks and other payment service providers to better protect their customers against online fraud, hidden fees and data leaks, the Parliament said on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国国家规划师要求仿人机器人企业避免生产重复性产品
item.description: 中国最高经济规划师发言人周四表示，中国仿人机器人企业应防止高度重复的产品进入市场，挤压研发空间。【原文：Chinese humanoid robot companies should prevent the risk of highly repetitive products entering the market and squeezing the space for research and development, the country's top economic planner's spokesperson said on Thursday.】

item.title: 摩根大通将在伦敦金丝雀码头建造巨大的英国新总部
item.description: 摩根大通周四表示，它将在伦敦东区的金丝雀码头金融区建造一座占地 300 万平方英尺（约合 28 万平方米）的大厦，在备受关注的英国预算案出台后，摩根大通承诺将对英国进行大笔投资，该预算案试图让投资者对英国的财政状况放心。【原文：JPMorgan said on Thursday it would build a 3-million-square-foot (280,000-square-metre) tower in the Canary Wharf financial district in East London, committing a big investment to Britain on the heels of a closely watched UK budget that has sought to reassure investors of the nation's finances.】

item.title: Naver 的支付部门将以 100 亿美元收购韩国加密货币交易所运营商
item.description: 韩国互联网巨头 Naver 旗下的 Naver Financial 已同意收购韩国最大的加密货币交易所 Upbit 的运营商 Dunamu，该交易为全股票交易，价值 15.13 万亿韩元（102.7 亿美元）。【原文：Naver Financial, a unit of South Korean internet giant Naver , has agreed to acquire Dunamu, an operator of the country's largest cryptocurrency exchange Upbit, in an all-stock deal valued at 15.13 trillion won ($10.27 billion).】
